review_body: I have an Siamese and an Oriental Shorthair.  Their coats are much shinier since I switched them to this food, and they both like it.

Our 3 year old indoor cat has eaten nothing else but Royal Canin dry food.  He was a stray dying kitten and couldn't hold anything down when we found him.  We switched from kitten to adult cat food at 1 year.  We liven this food up a bit with Purina Fortflora mixed in, half packet per day.  He is super healthy cat, no need for any canned food, snacks, etc.
summary: This is the only cat food we need

review_body: My vet recommended Royal Canin and I have learned over decades of being a cat mama that cheap food equates to geriatric health problems.  Ben and Jerry are weaning off of Royal Canin kitten food and this was purchased to get them used to adult food.  I couldn't get the bag open fast enough.  From experience, Royal Canin is prompt to refund your money if the cats won't eat it, depending on where you buy it.
Two Rag Doll cats love it and won't eat anything else. Leave a bowl for grazing while a half can of moist food for each in morning and one at night. keeps them fit without weight gain
summary: Two Rag Doll cats love it and won't eat anything else

review_body: My cat is PICKY!  He gets great checkups at the vet!
My cat loves this brand ,Its has a healthy ingredients

Originally didn't have any cats, but I sprinkled a few trails from the alley into my townhome's back door one Sunday afternoon and was able to lure 3 in. 2 of them had collars but I cut them off and threw them out. The other was a large stray with one eye and bald on top of his head. His name is one-eyed Willy and I gave him an eye patch. His two swash buckling deck mates are Wobbles (due to his crooked walk) and Squints (cause he always looks like he' squinting at something). They get along great and we're a happy fam. Anyway this cat food was great but I now cook 3 course meals for them every night, no more cat food for my crew.
summary: His two swash buckling deck mates are Wobbles (due to his crooked walk) and Squints (cause he always looks like he' squinting at something)

review_body: My vet recommended this food and I regret purchasing it without reading the ingredients. When I was tapering them off their old food (grain free ideal balance) they would just eat around the royal canin. It's full of CORN, SOY, and WHEAT GLUTEN. My lady cat's asthma has been way worse since switching them to this food. It's also incredibly un-filling as they continue to bug me for more food throughout the day. This never happened with their old food. This is overpriced junk food for cats. The most notable thing is the quality of their coats. My cats used to have the softest coats and be the talk of anyone who came over "I've never pet such soft cats!" but they just feel average now. My cats have all lost weight eating this food (which I mean is good they're fatties) but I think that goes to show it's not as good. Do your cats a favor and buy grain-free food!

So this stuff is overpriced. But maybe it isn't because the stool odor reduction is amazing.

I'm willing to pay more for a litterbox that actually has no scent what so ever.

I had two gassy little cats on Blue - this really was a game changer.

Worth the extra!

My 1 year old "attack" cat loves this crunchy stuff and can never get enough!  I alternate this with RC adult instinct minced wet - he feeds at will with one can in morning and one at night and this crunchy stuff in between.  He has been on RC since we got him at 1 1/2 mos. - he is now 13 lbs and super athletic - not a fat cat at all - lean and mean machine!!!!  That is my Macky boy!!!
summary: - he is now 13 lbs and super athletic - not a fat cat at all - ...

review_body: My 3 male cats love this food.

Both of my cats eat this food.  I try to give them some variety as my last cat was throwing up almost daily.  No animal chooses to eat the same thing all day, every day.  So I serve this with several other choices in the morning and at night.  Plus I give them a couple of treats so that they love me!  They seem quite content with this regime.
Cat loves it, so I love it.
summary: It's only her decision that matters

review_body:
I have 3 cats, each with thier own diet preferences and needs so food choices have been challenging at times.
The first time I got a bag of the Royal Canin it was recommended by the Vet for my elderly cat who has now passed on. All the cats liked it but it was hard for me to afford at the time so I switched back to whatever I was getting at Target at the time.
Then a few months ago I got a free bag of food at Petco so went with another small bag of the RC and let me tell you - I mixed it 1/2 and 1/2 with the other food since it was a smaller bag and my cats picked out the Royal Canin to eat and dropped the other food on the floor all around the bowl! At first I thought they were just being messy and every day I was picking up about a cup full of food off the floor, then I realized it was ONLY the (I think) purina which was mixed with the RC. Now that I am only feeding the Royal Canin there is no more mess around the food bowls! They are healthy and puking less as well.
summary: My cats won't eat other dry food now that they've had this

review_body: My aged mother is very particular about her Himalayan cast. This is exactly what her cat only vet recommended. Need I say more?
summary: This is exactly what her cat only vet recommended. Need I say more

review_body: My kittens suddenly didn't want their kitten kibble (also Royal Canin) about the time of their first birthday. I switched them to this, and my how they enjoy it! I've noticed no new hairball regurgitation and their litter boxes seem to smell better, even though they also get canned food. This is definitely very palatable to cats, and I've learned to trust Royal Canin for producing a good product that promotes good health in both dogs and cats.
Cats love it.
My cat loves this food. The only brand I will feed my pets

Order was received on due date and packaged well.  I was wanting to upgrade from Fancy Feast which they have eaten for years.  I WILL say they semi-warmed up to their bowls of new food by taking a few nibbles, which is more than they have done with line dry foods.  They are going to have to eat it because it's not cheap.  I think it is probably very good but my cats are ridiculously finicky.  This is the indoor, which may be the problem.  I have served it for about a week now and same -- a couple nibbled here and there when passing.  They are definitely upset and all 3 have an attitude with me right now.
The only reason I rated 3 is because MY cats don't like it.
summary: THEY GOBBLE UP THIS BRAND WET - DON'T LIKE DRY

review_body: great as usual!

This product makes my cat sick - he throws up as soon as we feed him.
I bought the food twice - a year a part - hoping that it was a problem with the batch, but it's not the case. The food makes my cat sick.
Same food bought from petstore works for him
summary: This food makes my cat sick

review_body: My cat came from a shealter, feed on cheap food. He was little, fur was dull and his waste was horrible. Needed a good adult indoor food, turned to this. He's put on a healthy weight, fur shiny and waste smelling better. I fed their simamese formula to my old cat, she loved it. He does too.
Our cats love this one!!!
Royal Canin food has improved my cats appetite, poop smell, poop frequency & seriously no more puking! The Kits look better & act better! Yay! Kiki, Bear, Bella & Tigger thank you! I thank you too!
Royal Canin quality - great value!
My cat was eating my dogs Royal Canin Food so now she has her very own and eats less. If they eat less it must be more satisfying for them and makes it less expensive in the long run.
Exactly as described.
My cats love this food. They are in good health. They have never complained:) This is great for my indoor cats.
Good product
Mix this with a smaller bag of hair ball royal canine food, and he has never had hair all issues, and he's a long haired pure breed Persian .

July of 2016, I was talked into adopting this adorable little puff ball of a cat. She was left in an apartment complex parking lot, and was all of 2 years old, and a tiny thing with huge feet.  Utterly adorable.  While my other cats had passed of old age, and I envisioned myself living a pet-free for a while... notsomuch once I met kitty.  Poor kitty came with a bag of Purina (egads!!) and because she's so darn fluffy, I knew we needed something special for her (hairball city!).  I tried Nutrish.  She looked at the bag and stared at me like "Really, you adopted me for this?"  She wouldn't eat it...
I tried a couple different expensive brands (Orijin and blue buffalo I think it was - they were in the 30-40.00 a bag range) - BAM!  Kitty says NO.
Finally after a couple of days, she ate juuuust enough of the Origin to be a victim, yet postpone starvation. After we exhausted the 40.00 bag, I came home with the 32.00 bag of Royal Canin.  WOW.  I am "warned" each time the bowl is empty, so that bowl is filled every morning!
Hazel's (aka Puff Puff Kitty/P-Kitty) litter box is in a contained area in the garage, accessible by a cat door so there's no smell in the house - however, when I dump the box, there is near zero odor.  I use the Arm & Hammer litter, nothing outrageous - the kibble is THE difference.  Tiny poop, next to no smell.  The earlier two bags of cat food were not so kind to the nose...  As long as they this kibble, P-Kitty's bowl will be full!
summary: This is great stuff - Puff Puff Kitty Approved!!!!!!

review_body: Cats love it and gobble it down. They are a healthy weight though and no more UTIs like when they were on the blue buffalo food.
summary: Cats love it and gobble it down

review_body: Im looking to change brands, my cat vomits this stuff too often.

The vet recommended this cat food since my cat has teeth problems and also was not eating. I have noticed a huge improvement in my cats overall health and the food helps remove the tarter from his teeth. The price for this cat food on Amazon is quite amazing. I was paying 15 dollars more from a retail store.
Purrrfect and decent price too

How many different brands and varieties have I bought for my senior cats who ultimately reject them? Countless. This one manages to please them going on several months now. Better quality than what one finds at the grocery, so that's awesome for these kitty kids.
My sphynx loves this food.
Good nutrition for our older cats.
For spoiled cats they eat this, they turn their nose up at canned food.
Well,,,, the cats like it. Too bad it costs more than steak.

This product did not state the detail that it is for cats 1-10 years old.  As my cats are much older, I can't use it, and then I find out that it is not returnable.  I'm out the cost, plus shipping, plus no cat food.

I love this for my Persian cat who has a history of kidney problems, including hospitalization for said kidney problems. I leave this out in a full bowl for him all day, and feed him 1/2 can of science diet urinary health formula canned cat food twice a day. Perhaps my favorite side effect of this food, besides the obvious health benefits, is that it makes his poop smell-free. Really, I can't smell anything when he uses the litterbox, nor do I smell anything when I sift it once a day.

I've ordered the bag from Amazon for a long time, and there have been no problems. It's cheaper than buying it from the store.

However, I can't recommend the product itself. Maybe it's a good idea for one bag only for weight loss purpose. But after 2 bags, my cats started to lose hair by a lot. So, I am stopping this one and will switch to Intense Hairball.
good

My three cats have been eating Royal Canin since they were 8 weeks old...first the kitten version and now the indoor.  They are all very healthy with healthy coats and best of all they are all within a healthy weight range.

The difference was noticible when a roommate moved in.  He had two older overweight cats eating meow mix.  Their fur was scruffy and I was stepping in vomit and hair balls daily.  The vomit was undigested piles of reddish meow mix food.  After switching them to this food no more vomit and or hair balls, their fur is soft and "purty". And even better yet their weight has become much healthier.  We feed free choice and not one of the cats is overweight even these two.

We also feed as a treat one 5.5 to 6 oz can of food a night for all five of them  to share as a treat.  We use Weruva, Wellness, Halo and occasionally other varieties.

I also would like to mention I fed my sixteen year old cat the Royal Canin kidney diet for cats after trying other brands this was the only one he would eat.  Between feeding Royal Canin dry, Wellness wet and supplementing with Azodyl he lived to the ripe old age of 19.

It was after seeing my other (then senior) cats prefer the prescription kidney diet over their regular diet that convinced me to completely switch to Royal Canin permantately.

As of right now my roommates cats are approximately 16 years old with no signs of kidney disease and my three guys are 2 years old and vibrant and healthy.  I just love petting and snuggling up to their soft silky coats.  And I plan on doing so for many more years to come thanks to a healthy diet
summary: Healthiest cats I have ever had

review_body: all 7 of my cats love this
Well, the cat eats it and that is enough for me!!
Great Product.
My cats love this food and it's good for them.

Anyone that has ever had a cat indoors knows the absolute joy of getting up in the middle of the night and stepping on a giant juicy hair ball that your wonderful fur baby left for you in the hallway . Eeegads . What a joy . But this food that we feed or two cats took care of the hair balls that our older cat used to have a few times a week . Have had them on this for a few years now . They run and play like the world is their play toy . They are never allowed out so I don't know if it's good for outdoor cats or not . But I know also that our older cat could clear out a stadium full of people , during play offs , in the fall , during an exciting game , after she pooped and this seemed to help clear that up too . Our vet recommended this food when her poop got so bad it was bringing down the property value every time she entered her litter box . Bless her heart . Ya gotta love them though . After these guys no more pets .
How long do cats live anyway ?
summary: Want healthier cats , cats that you want to live with ? Put them on this . Great food .

review_body: My 19 year old female, cat loves Royal Canin and she actually eats this dry food. Very happy with my purchase!
My cats like this and I buy it on occasion, but they prefer the Blue Buffalo brand of dry adult cat food.
summary: ROYAL CANIN FELINE HEALTH NUTRITION Indoor...

review_body: I love my cat, but she has a pretty sensitive stomach.  My vet recommended Royal Canin.  She seems to handle this food well.  However, it is not as good at hairball control as our previous food.  So now I have to give her a hairball "treat" daily.
Everything arrived when and as expected.
My cats eat this food well!
Always wonderful and healthy for my cats.
Expensive but cats really like it.  Makes their coats shiny and prevents inflammatory bowel disease.  Cheaper than the pet food box stores.
summary: Cats love it, vet says Royal Canin is well balanced

review_body: I'm not leaving the house for pet food anymore.
So far, so good.  The cats love it.
excellent product
My two cats love this food. I actually give it to them as treats.
Cats do really well and love this food.
Delicious as always
Cats seem to really like it.  Be sure to ease them in, they threw up a few times when transitioning, I think because it's so dense with nutrients.

review_body: cat aproved
all cats approved  !!
My cats love this food and is definitely helps with hairball control.
Great food.
We were new to the brand and Eddie seems to be okay with it, he is pretty finicky so I guess that's a good sign?
summary: he is pretty finicky so I guess that's a good sign

review_body: I've been feeding my cat this ever since I got her 5 years ago. It's one of the best foods out there and definitely keeps her healthy. She hasn't had any major health problems and I think it keeps her coat nice.

I've been feeding this to my cats for years. A breeder recommended it when I purchased a 'retired champion' oriental. The cats eat less of it, poop less and love it. None of my cats are fat, and their coats are sleek and healthy. Yes it's pricey but well worth it.
summary: A breeder recommended it when I purchased a 'retired champion' oriental

review_body: The three kitty sisters seem to like this pretty well, although they seem to be sort of picky about their food. Therefore, I'd say it is a winner.
Cat loves it! No hairballs!!!!

We've been feeding our cats Royal Canin for years. We've bounced around from brand to brand, but find when it comes to the least amount of hairballs this does a great job at keeping them to a minimum. None of our cats have discriminated against this food and we will continue to purchase the Indoor Adult formula for our cats.
summary: Keeps Our Cats Full and Relatively Hairball Free!

review_body: What a ROYAL rip off!!  I used to buy the indoor 40 light, which my cats loved, but then it their infinite wisdom, RC decided to double the price and replace the decent ingredients with heaven knows what, something cheaper for them to include obviously.  My 12 cats refused to eat it totally, (after having loved it)  so I tried a bag of the indoor 27, hoping they had not changed that formula.  My cats enjoyed it, thank goodness, I thought.  then I bought another large bag again, for the now exorbitant price and now evidently  they have changed the indoor 27  formula as well, the kibble seems larger, (I could be wrong, I did not save some of the good bag) but now my cats won't go near the dish. All of them, would rather be hungry than eat this whatever it is.  So now I have a big, expensive bag of food no one will eat, which cost more than it used to.  I guess RC thinks our cats are stupid and that their owners are stupid too, and that we will continue to pay higher prices for food our cats won't eat.  This is the last time, I will try experimenting with their new formulas, I am deeply disappointed, disgusted really. And the only reason I'm giving it one star is because I don't think I can give it no stars at all.
summary: New more expensive formulas are totally INEDIBLE say my 12 cats.

review_body:
BEST CAT FOOD
Better than Science Diet. having tried every dry/can cat food, ROYAL CANIN is the ONLY one my cats do not puke on. I have tried all the dry dog food as well, only ROYAL CANIN,,I feed my cats the RC puppy, price lower and perfect size chip
Royal Canin, the world's best , your cats will love you for it.
summary: BEST CAT FOOD Better than Science Diet

review_body: My cats thrive on Royal Canin

Royal Canin was what we have fed our cats since getting them as kittens from the shelter. All off a sudden northern cat will touch the indoor hairball food sonwe try this version. Cats are initially happy then when into the second bag non stop puke fest in the house. 2 unanswered emails to Royal Canin about formula changes go unanswered. Pretty sure they changed to formulas and won't own up to it. Avoid this crap!!!!

We tried this once, but it has a main ingredient of chicken meal, with lots of grains. We no longer feed ours anything with grains and try to avoid the chicken meal craptastic ingredient that's just the bones, beaks, feathers, etc ground up with actual healthy ingredients.
summary: There are healthier, cheaper choices without the chicken meal and grains.

review_body:
My kitty loves this stuff.

His coat is always soft and shiny. I know his food has a lot to do with that!

I really like this stuff, seems to keep kitty's teeth nice and clean, and he will tend to pick out these little bits from the mix of his dry food first.  Maybe they are saltier or fattier... either way the ingredients are pretty good and kitty gobbles them up.

I do have to say, it also help eliminate those poop odors.  And I think my cair has had maybe 2 hairballs coughed up in 2 years.  Granted he's a short hair cat, but still that's pretty good.
My cats' favorite dry food by far!  Healthy, good quality ingredients, and apparently tasty.
summary: My cats' favorite dry food by far!

review_body:
My girls love this food. They're always happy to eat it.

 However, the price just went up outrageously, for some stupid reason so, I am not going to be buying this from Amazon any more. WTH, so so so lame.
cat food

I only use royal canin for my cats.  I notice less barfing with this brand along with some gel once a week they are good to go

review_body: All 4 of my Cats love it!
Cats like this dry food.
The cats love it, and I order often. I have never had any problems with this seller.
it okay

I have one cat. I was feeding her I think purina and some other brands of dryfood when I adopted her and decided to change her food to royal canin which is what my dogs were eating also. I noticed she liked it a lot more. I'd watch her crunching on the pellets. She gets about a fresh cup a day and takes a few bites through the night. We're on the 4th or 5th bag already. I read something interesting that cats teeth deteriorate with a lot of dry foods out there because they tend to be too small and can't be chewed on and so cats just swallow them thus never "polishing" the teeth. Most dry food out there seem to have a cylindrical shape to them, this one is a nice large triangle. Maybe that's why she likes this one. I will keep buying this as long as she likes it.
summary: My cat seems to like this the best.

review_body: good for cat that not grow fat

3 picky bengal cats love this food - they all seem to have come down in weight a bit since changing to this, wouldn't call it weight control, but perhaps lower calories since its indoor.  Quality product.

Don't switch to grain free / gluten free foods unless your cat is having unique digestive issues.  Stick with the national brand that is tride and true!
summary: Select the best! Breeder recommended Royal Canin

review_body: Well, I don't love it, but the cat seems to like it a lot. This was the dry food I was told to feed him by the breeder and he thrives on it.reason to change.
They like it!
As an RVT I love Royal Canin, they make a great food product!!!!
My cats loved this product the minute they tasted it.

The cats like it but holy moly it's expensive.  Would have given it 5 Stars if it was more reasonably priced.  At least it costs less on Amazon than the pet store but it went from $27 last year to $40 in the last couple of months.  My cats have kidney issues so we need food lower in protein and our vet likes this brand.  We originally chose this over the prescription food because it was less expensive but we may need to reconsider.  Having Amazon Prime really helps save on the shipping!
summary: Good For Cats With Kidney Issues But It's Pricey

review_body: My cats really loved
cats love it

So far our very fussy eater of a cat, loves it!!  She had not been eating her other dry food..but chugging down the wet food--which she will ONLY eat 1 flavor..very fussy cat!  She knows what she likes and just wants that!!  And I have noticed he rpooh does not smell as bad--she is 1 of those cats that refuses to cover it!!  So far, so good, will update as time goes on
Keeps my two house kitties in top form, and they love it

review_body: Saved my 16 year old cat for she can't chew so good anymore.
Great food for a great price.
Our two cats like this food very much.

I also wrote a review on Royal Canin for kittens, and I don't feel any differently about this product for adults.  My cat loves it and transitioned from the kitten just fine.

Again, every cat is different, especially more exotic breeds of cat.  My mutt of a cat handles it fantastically, but your little furry friend may experience adverse symptoms (expressed by other reviewers). Check with your veterinarian for a second, professional opinion always.
summary: Excellent for my kitty but check with your vet!

review_body: The cats love it surely is expensive but they are worth it, if it truly does away with hairballs.

thanks
my Burmese like it

Since they are overweight, I give them the prescribed amount only  and if the dish is empty, no more until the next morning.  They sleep a lot and seem content. My stress level is down.  Thank you.
My cats are extremely picky.....They all love this brand.
Best cat food cats will eat has no smell going in or coming out!

cat loves it . fast service

What can I say about cat food...my cat liked it for a while then he got sick of it like he has with every other cat food on the planet. I like this brand so I'll probably stick with it and switch flavors.

Our cats are obsessed with Royal Canin. Because it's so pricey it's not their full time food-they each get a small handful every night as treats. Pretty sure it's the only reason they keep me around is because they don't know how to open the tub I store it in.

review_body: finally a larger size bag of a very good cat food
The cats like it
Cats love it.

All 3 of my babies love this brand. I rotate them on at least 3 different companies to avoid developing food allergies. But this is one of their favorites. It's my favorite because the potty odor is greatly diminished. I just wish they would come out with a "grain free" version.
This is the food my animals have been on since they reached adulthood. Great food, easy delivery, with very competitive prices.

While there is food of better quality out there my cats love this food. I tried to intoduce more expensive food since my older cat turned 5 years old and i was trying to prolong her life, but Royal Canin is her favorite. review_body: It's got quality ingredients and my cats love it, not sure what else there is to say.

review_body: WARNING WARNING WARNING---Royal Canin has changed all its formulas [cats too] it now uses Chicken BI-PRODUCTS Meal [ which mean that, by law they now use intestines which contain fecal matter, and other lower grade bi-products] the old formula was straight chicken meal, a much cleaner safer ingredient.  IF you go to the Royal Canin page you can read the updated ingredients, that have not yet been changed on amazon. For years all i have given my Persians was RC for Persians. NO MORE--they loved the product. And i an lucky that i had some product extra, and frozen, to use while i find a new food that does not have chicken poop, and other unseen nasties in it. And hope i will be able to find some my fine but at times fussy babies will love as well---*sigh* sad times.
summary: WARNING---change ingredients--you too can feed your cat chicken poop

review_body: We have been feeding this to our 2 cats for a number of years.  Unlike with other cheaper brands they have not had urinary problems etc. and constantly have healthy checkups.  They also don't seemt to gain a lot of weight off of it.
Recommended by our vet, now demanded by our cat.
Our cats like this stuff and that makes my wife happy
summary: Happy cats, Happy wife & Happy life

review_body: Excellent.

Expensive but my cat was raised on it, seems to like it and has had no hairballs or or elimination problems. He is in excellent shape and I will continue with 3/4 cup per day plus one teaspoon of  Fancy Feast. His weight is just about right, he is playful and vigorous. Good stuff.
summary: seems to like it and has had no hairballs or or elimination ...

review_body: Cats like it which is really the only thing that matters. We switch off every now and again with other Royal Canin varieties so they don't get bored but this one is a hit.

I don't have much to say - my old buddy who just died a couple of months ago, was a huge fan of the Royal Canin for mature cats . . . and, it obviously was good for him, too - he really thrived on it.  So, I bought this one for my new little girl.  She's a big fan.  She seems to have some difficulty chewing it - it's rather hard - but, she doesn't seem to mind - and seems to love the taste.

I am a big fan of Royal Canin - I highly recommend it!

My Maine Coon cat loves this food.  He actually likes it so much that I had to dispose of a previous brand that he would no longer eat.  Please feel free to visit http://goo.gl/BbrcqT to see a video of my cat enjoying this food.  The price of this food in most local stores is ridiculous but the Amazon.com price always seems to be reasonable.  I'm probably just going to go ahead and setup the Amazon.com automatic re-order for this.  All cats tastes are different but my Maine Coon cat truly loves this food!
summary: Sean Coonery the BIG Maine Coon Cat LOVES THIS!

review_body: This is the brand of cat food that the shelter was feeding the animals where we adopted our kitties.  It is a very high quality food and we have never stopped using this brand.  We, of course graduated to this formula when they were no longer kittens.  They love their dry food so much that eating wet food was not something they desire much.  We rarely have problems with hairballs because it does have hairball control, however, when your cats are part Maine Coon, you are bound to get a hairball once in a great while with all that fur.  Our cats never get sick of the food or have any digestive problems with it.  It is a great product and we will continue to feed this high quality product to our furry family members.

My cats love this food, second only to Royal Canin Maine Coon dry food.

Their coats feel softer, stool less smelly and less hairballs.

I have a 10 year old cat Raja (my grand kids named him) that for years refused to eat anything but "Meow Mix."  My other cats (2) all love "Blue Buffalo", a food I felt was much healthier for my babies  but Raja would refuse to eat, along with any other brands I consider healthier for my animals.  So I bought both brands for years.  That is until he developed an autoimmune condition and we had to remove almost all of his teeth. We had to switch to wet food and once again he would only eat  "Friskies"  brand canned food and then we had to make a "soup" out of it so he could eat it.  So...to make a long story longer, he suddenly began eating the dry food I give my 5lb Maltese. "Royal Canine" food for mini dogs.  I couldn't keep him out of it.  He even tore into the bag to get to it.  I then decided to try "Royal Canin" for  cats  and ordered  " Royal Canine feline health nutrition Indoor Mature 27 ".  Raja absolutely loves it and is beginning to turn his nose up at his "soup"  I have no idea how he is eating it with only a few teeth but he can be heard crunching when he is at his bowl.  The best part is he is suddenly putting on weight, his fur has gone from dull with dandruff, to shining and fluffy. He is playing and running around the house with his toys and climbing on the cat tree again. He is acting like a kitten, not the sluggish cat who looked sick and slept 23 hours a day.  I can't say enough about "Royal Canin."  Yes it is much more expensive than the grocery store brands I always felt guilty feeding the picky guy, but there is no price I can place on the wonderful transformation my aging cat has gone through.  The weirdest part is this transformation started when he began eating "Royal Canin" dog food.  So I give this food 5 stars.
I love that this high quality cat food is delivered right to my door step saving me that "one more thing to get done" shopping stop.
summary: Quality and delivered to my door step.

review_body: I will be buying this cat food again for my cats. The price was a little less than the pet store I usually get it from

I used to feed my cats on Iams top product, but they started throwing up more often so I decided to change their brand to Royal Canin since my German Shepherd does well on her Royal Canin for German Shepherd dogs. After gradually weaning them off the Iams and onto this, they have not thrown up again. They love this brand and are doing well on it. I bought indoor because my cats are indoor cats, but I think I may try the Maine coon variety next. My cats are very active and run around the house and get plenty of indoor exercise so I don't think they really need the weight control variety. The litter box smells fresher too !
This is a lower calorie food my vet recommended for my kitties. Item arrive as expected. The cats seem to like it.

Amazon told me they would send out a new bag. I was contacted twice (email - with no reply email bounced back) regarding this and was happy they were replacing the bag. I was in the USA on holidays and was taking the food home with me but they sent a replacement after I was back in Canada. The old food was contaminated and thrown in the garbage in Michigan. Now I am home in Canada and I am being told to ship the old kibble back. Not happy at all as it is gone in the garbage. They apparently sent the other bag to my relatives and are charging my visa for it.  Not happy at all! Huge RIP off..
summary: Bag opened - food coming from box and 2 slashes in bag

review_body: My indoor-only cats love this dry food, even more than their wet cat food (we're down to one brand and one flavor of wet food now).  My vet loves this food, too, and always commends me upon using Royal Canin dry cat food. I mix three different products, however: this Indoor Adult 27 formula, the Maine Coon formula (yes, I have one), and the Indoor Beauty and Fit Care 35 in a 1:1:1 mix.  Both cats love this mix (even the non-Maine Coon likes the larger kibble of the Maine Coon formula).  I get compliments on their coats; the short-haired black and white tuxedo's coat looks like velvet and just shines; the Maine Coon's coat has no tangles.  I have very little hairball issues, even though they are a bonded pair and wash each other often.  However, the Maine Coon constantly eats cat grass but the tuxedo does not and that can present a hairball issue...but not very often ("once in a blue moon"!).  They are healthy, happy, beautiful boys (neutered, of course!)...and I give lots of credit to their Royal Canin dry cat food diet.
summary: What more can I say...another GREAT Royal Canin product!

review_body: My cats love pretty much all the prodcuts.  This one has the dental and hairball component.  I would recommend the item to friends.

Been buying it for years at the advice of my vet friend.  Every cat loves it!

Local store: $47.  Here: $34.  No brainer.

At one point it was no longer prime eligible and the price went higher than local stores, but it seems to be even less expensive than before now, and is prime eligible again.

This is a very good product.
My cats always finish their food.
Never any leftovers.

Litter box never smells.
always solid stools

worth the money.
Your pets will have less visits to the vet
and are content with this food.
Trying to buy better food for our cats but it is so expensive. Thank to Amazon, we can buy the better food at a discount.
My two cats love it and it is good for them as they are indoor only cats.. Will order again.
I love this cat food.  I've used Royal Canin Indoor for almost 10 years.  The cats love the taste and even if I switch, I always come back to this brand and type.

Cats are doing well on this dry food.  did "taste test" w/the Adult vs the Mature.  Definitly my cats like the Adult better.  mine are 8 to 10 yrs (3 cats).  I am now feeding canned in morning and royal canin dry throughout the day.  seems to be working well.

I love my cat, I got 5 boxes of gravy cat food,in two different brands and 3 bags of dry food, in 3 different brands. I recieved Royal Canin the last, but when the bag shows in front of my cat, he went crazy. He always finish the Royal dry food first, before anything. And the most remarkable thing is, the first day i open the Royal bag,didnt give him any, because theres still different foods from other brands in his bowls, but he stop eatting the food, and start to chase down the piece of the bag i throwed in the bin... That is just how much my cat love Royal Canin cat food. So now i only leave Royal dry food in his toy, just make him play more. Highly recommended if you love your cat as much...
and I like that it helps with her hairballs.  I mix this with the Maine Coon 31 so she eats quite a bit slower than a normal cat.
my cat really liked this. she didn't like blue buffalo but this one she enjoys. i also think it is one of the healthier cat foods at a reasonable price
I have been feeding my cats RC indoor 27 for a few years now.  Their coats are so soft and smooth.

I have been feeding my four cats Royal Canin brand foods (Indoor Light and  Adult, Intense Hairball, Oral Sensitive, and Hair and Skin), for years because of the quality of their food. Unfortunately, they have now decided that not only will they be adding by-products to their food but that we're so dumb we'll believe the only by-products they're going to add are good for our furry loved ones. They even had one of their own vets, Emmanuel Fontaine, produce a condescending flyer entitled "Why we should not be afraid of chicken by products." You can read this flyer at [...] or [...]

While the by-products they list in their flyer may have nutritional value, there is no promise from Royal Canin that they won't also be adding intestines, heads, feet and so on. According to the AAFCO, the following definitions constitute acceptable ingredients when listed as such:

Chicken/Poultry Meal (current main ingredient in their food): "Poultry Meal is the dry rendered product from a combination of clean flesh and skin with or without accompanying bone, derived from the parts of whole carcasses of poultry or a combination thereof, exclusive of feathers, heads, feet, and entrails."

Chicken/Poultry By-Product: "Poultry By-Products must consist of non-rendered clean parts of carcasses of slaughtered poultry such as heads, feet, vicera, free from fecal content and foreign matter except in such trace amounts as might occur unavoidably in good factory practice."

Chicken/Poultry By-Product Meal:"Poultry By-Product Meal consists of the ground, rendered, clean parts of the carcass of slaughtered poultry, such as necks, feet, undeveloped eggs, and intestines, exclusive of feathers, except in such amounts as might occur unavoidably in good processing practices."

Yummy, huh? I'm currently researching better foods to feed my babies. (As yet, the only Royal Canin products I can find that have by-products in them are their dog recipes, but I'm not waiting for them to cheapen their cat foods. I've switched my cats to Orijen 80/20 Cat and Kitten food.)

On May 14th I sent the following email to Royal Canin. Not surprisingly, they haven't responded. After you read their flyer, I would encourage you to do the same. Perhaps they'll change their mind.

I recently came across the February 1, 2013 article written by Emmanuel Fontaine, DVM, regarding the addition of chicken by-products to your pet foods.

Of the many reasons I feed my four cats Royal Canin, one primary is the absence of by-products. The inclusion of by-products has been and will always be the first thing that eliminates a food, and quite often the food company, from my shopping list and your article has not changed my opinion on this.

Yes, I read the entire article including the nutritional values you provided for each by-product that will be included. I also noted your all too equally balanced pie charts and my questions are:

1. Will the six items given in the article be listed as individual ingredients or will they simply be lumped into a single listing under the by-product label?

2. Are these six ingredients the only by-products being added or will there be additional by-products that have little, no or detrimental nutritional value?

3. If chicken meal and by-product meal are so equal in nutritional value, why not be more forthcoming in the ingredients listings on your packages instead of lumping them into a single item that can easily include just about anything else.

4. When you begin to include the aforementioned by-products in your pet foods, will you then remove the vitamins and minerals that you claim these by-products are supposed to provide? If you will not be removing the added vitamins and minerals from the ingredients, why?

5. Since, as you say, chicken brains, blood, bones, connective tissue, hearts and livers are so valuable to good nutrition, are you consuming them? Not your pets. You, your family? I certainly don't consume them, nor do I feed them to my family and by extension will not feed them to my beloved pets.

I very recently purchased three bags of Royal Canin - Indoor Light, Intense Furball and Special 33, part of my own blend of nutrition for my two Ragdolls, American shorthair and Norwegian Forest cat. I didn't know it would likely be my last.

Sincerely,
(Me)
summary: Royal Canin Chooses Cheap Ingredients Over Your Pet

review_body: My cat's a fussy eater, but he really likes Royal Canin Dry Cat Food. I buy the indoor formula because he's an indoor cat, and he is thriving on it. As I get toward the bottom of the bag, as with all dry food I've tried with him, the flavor/scent must diminish a bit because he's less interested, but open a new bag and he literally tries to dive into it to grab a bite! I'm very happy with this product and how well the cat is doing on it. Highly recommended. And, Amazon has the best price I've been able to find.

I've tried many different kinds of cat food over the years and this is the best, hands down for my indoor cats.  They love the taste and it keeps their weight in check.  I doubt I will switch any time soon.

My cats tolerated this food in very small amounts as I was introducing it, but after going to half this and half of their old food they began to vomit. One cat threw it up undigested 2 days in a row hours after he had eaten it and both of my other cats were vomiting  every other night or so. I switched back to their old food and all is well again.

I was very disappointed as the cats tolerate Royal Canin 33 quite well, but I wanted a food with slightly less protein for my older cat. In the past I have had issues with many brands of cat food that were labeled for indoor cats. The search goes on.....

It's a bit more expensive than your average cat food but my kitty loves this stuff -- it keeps him healthy, shiny and fit.  Unfortunately, he now knows the difference between this stuff and the "emergency" food I've tried to feed him when I run out, and he'll have none of it.

Ingredient List*
Royal Canin Cat Food Ingredient List

Chicken meal, brown rice, rice, corn, corn gluten meal, chicken fat, chicken, natural chicken flavor, pea fiber, rice flour, rice hulls, wheat gluten, dried beet pulp (sugar removed), soya oil, sodium silico aluminate, dried brewers yeast, fructo-oligosaccharides (FOS), anchovy oil (source of EPA/DHA), calcium sulfate, salt, potassium chloride, dried egg product, choline chloride, DL-methionine, taurine, Vitamins [DL-alpha tocopherol acetate (source of vitamin E), L-ascorbyl-2-polyphosphate (source of vitamin C), niacin supplement, biotin, riboflavin (vitamin B2) supplement, D-calcium pantothenate, vitamin A acetate, pyridoxine hydrochloride (vitamin B6), thiamine mononitrate (vitamin B1), folic acid, vitamin B12 supplement, vitamin D3 supplement], sodium tripolyphosphate, tea (green tea extract), Trace Minerals [zinc oxide, zinc proteinate, ferrous sulfate, manganese proteinate, copper proteinate, copper sulfate, manganous oxide, calcium iodate, sodium selenite], L-Carnitine, preserved with natural mixed tocopherols (source of vitamin E) and citric acid, rosemary extract.
Read less
*for Royal Canin INDOOR Adult 27
Please note I DO NOT FEED my cat this as  more then half of the ingredient content is grain/carbohydrate. I only posted this review because someone asked about ingredient list which I found from the manufacturer.
summary: Ingredient List only: I DO NOT FEED THIS

review_body: I had the kittens (now cats) on the Royall Canin 36 kitten formula and needed to switch them (both indoor cats) to an adult dry food. I had no transition issues; both cats (including one cat who is extremely picky as an eater) quickly adapted to the Adult 27 Formula; in fact, I think they both like it more than the Kitten 36 version. I've ordered their food from this vendor several times and it always arrives on time with no issues/complications..

After my daughter's 9-yr old cat was attacked, requiring extensive surgery and our family's heartbreak with this ordeal, we decided to keep him indoors.  We tried other dry cat foods but after a while, our cats don't care for it anymore, so we go to the store and try other brands.  It was time for advice from our pet store.  We were told of Royal Canin Dry Cat Food, Indoor 27 Formula and purchased a small bag first.  To our delight, he and the other 2 older cats love it!  We give it to them in small quantities to keep it's freshness and they eat every bit of it.  We are grateful our pet store told us of this product and that this can be found on Amazon in larger quantities. We ordered a larger bag; it was delivered and we can even arrange for it to be sent automatically.  It doesn't get any easier than this.  As a cat lover, I recommend this product highly.  There is nothing more gratifying than knowing your pet is healthy, happy and purring.  And when they beg for more food, we know it's nutritious and good for them.

I've been feeding my Bengal this food his whole life. I notice a major difference if we run out and he eats other food. His litter box stinks to high heaven, this is supposed to be easier to digest and stink less. The little domestic shorthair I adopted has had much improved fur quality

I have been hearing all this jargon about not feeding cats dry food, but this is a good cat food even for picky eaters. I do feed my cats wet food three times a week (Royal Canin Instinctive). My cats always get good health reviews by my vet and they love this food. Good for even sensitive tummy's.

I switched over to this food to see if I could eliminate the frequency of my 13 year old cat puking. She's been doing that for about five months and losing weight. After a $400 trip to the vet, they found nothing wrong. After much research and reading positive reviews, I bought this food. She loves it, looks better, isn't puking and I am happy!

I use this as a supplement to her diet of canned food. Saying she's picky is redundant, she's a cat. She is an indoor cat (as all cats should be)and is healthy, well nourished and at a good weight. Instead of giving her unhealthy treats I give her small handfuls as a reward or just a token of love. I just have to say "treats" and she comes running. It's a win win because she gets the nutritional benefits she needs and the satisfaction from knowing that she's manipulated me into giving her something special. Two can play the feline mind game!
summary: So good she thinks these morsels are treats

review_body: I have 3 cats (over 7 years old) who eat this indoor kibble daily. They love it and no longer have hairball or constipation problems. Sometimes I alternate the indoor formula with another Royal Canin formula. These are healthy cats who have never had problems more serious than hairballs or isolated stool issues due to too little water or feasting on dog food or my food. I have had cats living with me since childhood and have used many cat food brands. I am very pleased and plan to continue with this brand.

I've been feeding this food to my cat for about a month now. I had it mixed with his old food for 2 weeks and have been feeding him only the Royal Canin for the last 2 weeks.

The only good thing I can say about this food is his fur has gotten thicker and his skin isn't flaky. Aside from that, a cat who has NEVER had stomach problems has been experiencing diarrhea and vomiting in the last week. His poop smells WORSE and he hasn't had a solid poop in 2 weeks either. This food has truly been an awful experience and I will not be buying anymore.
summary: Yeah his fur looks great, but...

review_body: I bought this kibble for my senior cat after trying several brands. She is healthy but has trouble digesting kibble. Her hairball problem has disappeared and she likes it very much. My other three cats also eat this and no longer have a problem with hairballs. All four are full of energy and look good (fur is soft and gleaming, healthy in general). I also use several other Royal Canin kibbles along with this one. Very pleased.
summary: My four cats like this very much

review_body: For years I had just bought grocery store cat food, until my older cat developed kidney problems.  My vet suggested switching to a higher quailty food.  Not only did my VERY picky cat love this food, but he no longer has any kidney issues.  The food may be more expensive, but it has probably saved me thousands of dollars in vet bills.
summary: All three of my cats love it, and it reversed major medical problems with older cat.

review_body: We purchased our Ragdoll kitten from a well known breeder in South Fl. in 2008. Her cats were raised on Royal Canin dry food. When we took delivery, we just continued purchasing the same product. Unfortunately, it is expensive. My Mother always had cats around while I was growing up. Vet service & pet products were mostly unheard of back in the '40,s & '50,s. unless you had a dairy or horses. There are so many products & services available today to keep our pets healthy. I will continue to maintain present diet & vet service. I enjoy our healthy pet. She is good company for seniors with an empty nest.

My cat eats this. She seems to like it, as I refill her bowl regularly, and she tells me when her bowl is empty. As claimed on the bag, her crap doesn't stink as bad as some other things (such as carrion, or a trash dump). She only barfs it up once in a while.
summary: My cat's breath doesn't smell like cat food

review_body: the product is good
It seems good, but my cat doesn't seem to like it so much.
